tit.cmt: (Ministry of Making and Mending Palaces) を追記しました。
tit.e: Zogusho (Ministry of Making and Mending Palaces)

sen.j: 造宮省（ぞうぐうしょう）とは、宮城の造営・修理を掌る造宮卿（ぞううぐうきょう）を長とする令外官。
sen.e: Zogusho was an extra statutory office responsible for castle building and repairing headed by Zogukyo.
Zogusho was an extra statutory office responsible for castle building and repairing headed by Zogukyo (Minister of Making and Mending Palaces).
sen.cmt: (Minister of Making and Mending Palaces) を追記しました。
sen.e: Zogusho was an extra statutory office responsible for castle building and repairing headed by Zogukyo (Minister of Making and Mending Palaces).

sen.j: 大宝律令制定時（大宝 (日本)元年（701年））に設置された造宮職（ぞうぐうしき）が、和銅元年（708年）に省に昇格したものである。
sen.e: When the Taiho Ritsuryo Code was enacted in 701, Zogushiki was established, and in 708, Zogushiki was raised to Zogusho.
When the Taiho Ritsuryo Code was enacted in 701, Zogushiki (Office of Making and Mending Palaces) was established, and in 708, Zogushiki was raised to Zogusho.
sen.cmt: Zogushiki に (Office of Making and Mending Palaces) を追記しました。
sen.e: When the Taiho Ritsuryo Code was enacted in 701, Zogushiki (Office of Making and Mending Palaces) was established, and in 708, Zogushiki was raised to Zogusho.

sen.j: 律令制の確立する以前に造宮官（ぞうぐうかん）という官司が存在していた（設置時期は不詳）が、大宝律令が完成する直前の大宝元年7月27日 (旧暦)（701年9月4日）に造宮職に改められた。
sen.e: Although it is unknown the period of the establishment, there had been an office 'Zogukan' before the ritsuryo system was established; on September 4, 701, immediately before the completion of the Taiho ritsuryo code, Zogukan was renamed Zogushiki.

Although it is unknown the period of the establishment, there had been an office 'Zogukan' before the ritsuryo system was established; on September 8, 701, immediately before the completion of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), Zogukan was renamed Zogushiki.
sen.cmt: September 4 を September 8 に修正しました。Taiho ritsuryo code をTaiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) に修正しました。
sen.e: Although it is unknown the period of the establishment, there had been an office 'Zogukan' before the ritsuryo system was established; on September 8, 701, immediately before the completion of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), Zogukan was renamed Zogushiki.

sen.j: その後、平城京への遷都構想が本格化した和銅元年3月13日 (旧暦)（708年4月8日）に造宮省に昇格して初代造宮卿に大伴手拍が任命された。
sen.e: Later, the idea of removing the capital to Heijokyo turned into reality; on April 8, 708, Zogushiki was raised to Zogusho with OTOMO no Tauchi appointed the first head of Zogusho.
Later, the idea of removing the capital to Heijokyo turned into reality; on April 12, 708, Zogushiki was raised to Zogusho with OTOMO no Tauchi appointed the first minister of Zogusho.
sen.cmt: April 8 を April 12 に修正しました。head を minister に修正しました。
sen.e: Later, the idea of removing the capital to Heijokyo turned into reality; on April 12, 708, Zogushiki was raised to Zogusho with OTOMO no Tauchi appointed the first minister of Zogusho.

sen.j: 八省の卿のうち、最も高い中務卿は正四位上であるにも関わらず、造営卿の官位相当が最高で従二位とされ、また工事に動員された人士の監督のために造宮卿には大伴氏などの軍事を司ってきた氏族より任命されるなど、遷都に際して新しい宮殿の造営を重視していた。
sen.e: Construction of the new castle in the new capital was considered an important project--The head of Zogusho was given Junior Second Rank, as equivalent to its government post, which was the highest among all ministers, while the head of the Ministry of Central Affairs ranked Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, which was the highest among the statutory eight ministries; besides, the head of Zogusho was appointed among military clans like the Otomo clan, as their ability to supervise the laborers mobilized for the construction project was counted on.

sen.j: 四等官の下には官人雑任・将領・算師・工（長上・番上）などが属していた。
sen.e: Under the four-tiered hierarchy of government officials, there were kanjin-zonin, shoryo, sanshi, ko (chojo, banjo), and the like.

Under the four-tiered hierarchy of government officials, there were Kanjin Zonin (lower-ranking government official), Shoryo (chief), Sanshi (court official in charge of calculation), Ko (workman [a craftsman in the "chojo" rank and a carpenter in the "banjo" rank]) and so on.

sen.j: だが、桓武天皇による行政改革と長岡京遷都に向けた組織の再編成を目的として、延暦元年4月11日 (旧暦)（782年5月27日）に勅旨省とともに廃止された。
sen.e: Zogusho was abolished with Chokushisho on May 27, 782, as government reorganization in preparation for the administrative reform and the removal of capital to Nagaokakyo led by Emperor Kanmu.
Zogusho was abolished with Chokushisho on May 31, 782, as government reorganization in preparation for the administrative reform and the removal of capital to Nagaokakyo led by Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: May 27 を May 31 に修正しました。
sen.e: Zogusho was abolished with Chokushisho on May 31, 782, as government reorganization in preparation for the administrative reform and the removal of capital to Nagaokakyo led by Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: その後、平安京遷都時に藤原小黒麻呂を長官とする造宮職が復活したが、延暦24年（805年）の藤原緒嗣と菅野真道による「徳政論争」によって平安京造営が中止された際に廃止された。
sen.e: After that, Zogusho revived with FUJIWARA no Oguromaro appointed the head when the removal of capital to Heiankyo took place; however, it was abolished when 'Tokusei dispute' broke out between FUJIWARA no Otsugu and SUGAWARA no Masumichi in 805 and the construction of Heiankyo was canceled.
